Dear Friend,

For 100 years, the Technion has been the technological backbone of Israel. Technion alumni have developed countless technologies — from the world-renowned Iron Dome to groundbreaking new tools like Iron Beam — that save lives and ensure the nation thrives.

But enriching and empowering the minds who develop these technologies takes the support of all of us. Can we count on you?

HELP REACH OUR 100-DONOR FEBRUARY GOAL!
Give Now

Matthew Kehres
Chief Executive Officer, American Technion Society

 

Reach Out and Touch the Future

What if technology allowed us not only to see and hear each other but also to feel – examining a sick patient or tucking in a grandchild from across the globe? Discover how the research of Technion Professor Lihi Zelnik-Manor is bringing us closer to such possibilities.

Technion in the News

Fixing Hearts, Changing Lives

A breakthrough in heart repair is on the horizon: LifeCord’s innovative device offers a minimally invasive alternative to open-heart surgery for mitral regurgitation. With first-in-human trials set for 2025, could this be the future of cardiac care?

Read

How RNA Research Could Transform Medicine

Could cutting-edge RNA research unlock new treatments for cancer and brain diseases? Technion scientists are exploring innovative genetic therapies that could change the future of medicine.
